title: Limestone spiral staircase

properties.name: description
properties.value: A limestone spiral staircase can be built in the Rug space and Stair space of the Skill Hall, Quest Hall, and Dungeon in a player-owned house. It requires 67 Construction to build and when built, it gives 1,040 experience. The player must have a hammer and a saw in their inventory to build it.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Limestone spiral staircase
Spiral staircase
Icon
Furniture nameStaircase
Released31 May 2006 (Update)

FlatpackableNo
ExamineI can climb up or go down these stairs.
Advanced data
Object ID13503
Icon Item ID8258

A limestone spiral staircase can be built in the Rug space and Stair space of the Skill Hall, Quest Hall, and Dungeon in a player-owned house. It requires 67 Construction to build and when built, it gives 1,040 experience. The player must have a hammer and a saw in their inventory to build it.

The direction that non-spiral staircases face when built can be chosen from any angle that the room is built, as all rooms, after selection and prior to building, can be rotated with all of the room's hotspots visible. By default, the stairs will slope down away from the direction it is built, and must be rotated clockwise or anticlockwise twice in order to face the player.

Other complications associated with staircases involve adding rooms, or changing the staircase.

A staircase added to a Skill Hall on the regular level will prompt you to build it "Up" or "Down". When building an "Up" staircase, then attempting to climb the staircase, the construction interface will ask if you want to add a room at the top of the staircase. The rooms available at the top are either a Quest Hall or a Skill Hall. If the player builds a "Down" staircase, there is an additional option of building a Dungeon stairs room downstairs.

A '''limestone spiral staircase''' can be built in the [[Rug space]] and [[Stair space]] of the [[Skill Hall]], [[Quest Hall]], and [[Dungeon (Construction)|Dungeon]] in a [[player-owned house]]. It requires 67 [[Construction]] to build and when built, it gives 1,040 [[experience]]. The player must have a [[hammer]] and a [[saw]] in their inventory to build it.

The direction that non-spiral staircases face when built can be chosen from any angle that the room is built, as all rooms, after selection and prior to building, can be rotated with all of the room's hotspots visible. By default, the stairs will slope down away from the direction it is built, and must be rotated clockwise or anticlockwise twice in order to face the player.

Other complications associated with staircases involve adding rooms, or changing the staircase.

A staircase added to a Skill Hall on the regular level will prompt you to build it "Up" or "Down". When building an "Up" staircase, then attempting to climb the staircase, the construction interface will ask if you want to add a room at the top of the staircase. The rooms available at the top are either a Quest Hall or a Skill Hall. If the player builds a "Down" staircase, there is an additional option of building a [[Dungeon (Construction)|Dungeon]] stairs room downstairs.
